column4: anyone tell me how id go about uninstalling firefox3.0 preview and installing current ff3?
how did you install the preview?
hmm, that doesn't help very much.  what does this return?   dpkg -l *firefox*
it sends out a printoutlike bunch of stufff
ok, can you put that up on a pastebin?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/31662/
yep, coming up
sudo aptitude purge $(dpkg -l | grep -i firefox | cut -d " " -f 2);  sudo aptitude update;  sudo aptitude install firefox
better to copy and paste all that in.. but you can chop them down. though what would be the point? :)
one step ahead of you there :)
hmm, i'm not sure i follow? what do you mean?
3.0.1+build1+nobinonly-0ubuntu0.8.04.3 is the current version
you on hardy i assume?
unfortunately, firefox3 is only available in the hardy repos.
pretty much yea
there are a few nagging issues -- if firefox3 is the only reason you have to upgrade, i would say, don't
you can install firefox 3 from mozilla's download
http://download.mozilla.org/?product=firefox-3.0.1&os=linux&lang=en-US
these instructions work despite being for the beta.  http://linuxowns.wordpress.com/2008/02/15/install-firefox-3-beta-3-on-ubuntu/
errm no, but the command i gave you earlier should remove the "preview"
what's up/?
you don't usually have permissions in that directory. you might need to use sudo as appropriate
you can, though it's not recommended.
